result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael P. VANDENBROECK was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Register and comply with sex offender registry.  

No use or possession of a smartphone. 

No use or possession of internet capable/enabled devices without agent's permission.

No contact with minors unless approved by agent.  

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

timeConds.notes: stayed, to be imposed at agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Plea date at 03-03-2016 11:00 am

Jury Trial set for 03-22-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 1.
Scheduling conference set for 09-03-15 at 10:00 a.m.
Plea date at 08-27-2015 01:30 pm
Plea date at 06-11-2015 03:30 pm

Parties state they are waiting on more discovery.   
Status/scheduling conference set for 04-09-15 at 2:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Status conference is set for 02-25-15 at 3:00 p.m.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedcings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 11-18-14 at 11:00 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Counsel argue about bail.  Court wants more information regarding the business before any ruling on bail is made. 
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 11-05-14 at 2:15 p.m.  
Minutes.
Letter from defendant indicating his current telephone number.
Cover letter.
RE:  Use computer to facilitate a sex crime, on 10-10-14.
Affidavit of Detective Sgt. Peter McGinty, Two Rivers Police Department.
At 1:15 p.m., search warrant for Apple iPhone with return of officer thereon.
Affidavit of Detective Sgt. Peter McGinty, Two Rivers Police Department.
At 2:01 p.m. search warrant for 2010 black Mercedes sedan with return of officer thereon.
Search warrant issued.  RE:  2010 black Mercedes sedan with Michigan registration 2819J5 owned by Michael Vandenbroeck.
Affidavit of Detective Sgt. Peter McGinty, Two Rivers Police Department.
At 2:01 p.m. search warrant for Cool City Motel with return of officer thereon.
Search warrant issued.  RE:  Cool City Motel, 3009 Lincoln Avenue, Two Rivers, WI for the property of Michael Vandenbroeck.
Search warrant issued.  RE:  Black and Silver Apple iPhone cellular telephone with FCC number 8CG-E2380A owned by Michael P. Vandenbroeck.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of child enticement and use computer to facilitate a sex crime.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-27-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and that he have no contact with any person under the age of 18 and no use of the internet and no possession of any internet enabled devices.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
